name: SBOM-uClibc-version
description: The uClibc version was determined to be 0.9.32.1 through filename analysis. Although attempts to extract version information from the string table and symbol table were unsuccessful, the version number in the filename serves as definitive evidence. It is recommended to further verify known vulnerabilities for this version of uClibc. While there may be inconsistencies between the filename version and the actual internal version, this currently represents the most reliable source of version information.
notes: It is recommended to further verify known vulnerabilities in this version of uClibc. The file name version may not match the actual internal version, but this currently represents the most reliable source of version information.

name: SBOM-SQLite-version
description: The SQLite version was confirmed as 3.7.4 in the file lib/libsqlite3.so.0.8.6. The version information was obtained from the sqlite3_version string variable within this binary file. No public CVE vulnerability records for this specific version were found in the NVD database. It is recommended to review the changelog and release notes of SQLite 3.7.4 to identify potential security fixes. Although not recorded in NVD, undisclosed security issues may exist.

name: SBOM-OpenSSL-version
description: The file lib/libssl.so.1.0.0 was found to contain OpenSSL version 1.0.2h information, which has multiple known critical vulnerabilities. Version string evidence resides in the binary's string table. Identified critical CVEs include: CVE-2016-2177 (score 9.8), CVE-2016-2176 (score 8.2), CVE-2016-2105 (score 7.5), among others. It is recommended to upgrade to an unaffected OpenSSL version as soon as possible.
notes: The identified critical CVEs include: CVE-2016-2177 (9.8 score), CVE-2016-2176 (8.2 score), CVE-2016-2105 (7.5 score), among others. It is recommended to upgrade to an unaffected OpenSSL version as soon as possible.

name: SBOM-BusyBox-version
description: The BusyBox version 1.14.1 information was found in multiple files under the usr/bin directory. The version string evidence is 'BusyBox v1.14.1 (2016-11-29 12:02:43 CST)'. No public CVE vulnerability records were found for this version.
notes: It is recommended to verify whether this version of BusyBox has any undisclosed security issues.

name: SBOM-MiniDLNA-version
description: The MiniDLNA version 1.0.24 information was found in the usr/bin/minidlna binary file. The version string evidence is 'Starting MiniDLNA version 1.0.24 [SQLite %s]'. No publicly recorded CVE vulnerabilities were found for this version.
notes: It is recommended to check the changelog of MiniDLNA 1.0.24 to confirm the security fixes.

name: SBOM-Firmware-version
description: Firmware version 1.13 was found in the etc/config/buildver file, but no related CVE records were identified. The version information is incomplete, requiring further analysis of the binary files to obtain more comprehensive component version details.
notes: Verify whether the buildver file reliably reflects the actual firmware version.

name: SBOM-httpd-version
description: The version information of mathopd 1.227 was found in sbin/httpd. The version string evidence is '$Id: main.c,v 1.227 2007/07/21 11:38:23 boland Exp $'. No public CVE records were found for this version.
notes: mathopd is a lightweight web server; it is recommended to check its security advisories.

name: SBOM-smbd-version
description: The Samba 3.0.24 version information was found in sbin/smbd. The version string evidence is 'Samba 3.0.24'. Although no public CVE records for this version were found in NVD, this extremely outdated version may contain undisclosed vulnerabilities.
notes: Samba 3.0.24 was released in 2007 and may contain undocumented security vulnerabilities.
